Node.definition: = exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= causative action by which alcoholic drinks have a numbing effect on humans, comparable to being beaten by a hammer

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God
= state in which something is beautiful and attractive to look at
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities|literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations
literally: fat; hence: = state in which land or food is of an exceedingly good quality
= state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense
= state in which humans and deities have physical, political, and/or military strength
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect
= pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction
= event that causes the end of a large number of people
= process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect
= state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
= state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God
= state in which something is beautiful and attractive to look at
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities|literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations
literally: fat; hence: = state in which land or food is of an exceedingly good quality
= fruit of the fig (תְּאֵנָה) tree, of the variety that ripens early (in June); ► appreciated because of their fine flavor
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

= hot season of the year, opposite of חֹרֶף (חֹרֶף) ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the inner part of the human hand (יָד) but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.
= action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= circular or semi circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection
= state in which something is beautiful and attractive to look at
exact meaning unsure, probably: = circular band worn around the head; ≈ associated with a position of honor and repect
= a spiritual entity coming over humans and triggering attitudes corresponding to its character and purpose
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

Node.gloss: to (cause to) turn back|to cause to cease|to avert|to revoke
Node.definition: literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = causative action by which humans cause a certain condition in which they are not personally involved to come to an end
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= action by which humans move about unsteadily and without sense of direction

= alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
= action by which humans move about unsteadily and without sense of direction

= alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = to be unable to think clearly, as if one's mind is failing

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

= alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness
= action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
literally: stumble; hence: = to act in a way that is morally and ethically wrong ◄ as if walking through life in an unsteady way

literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= food or other items expelled from the stomach ◄ due to excessive alcohol consumption; ≈ associated with behavior inviting ridicule
literally: excrement; hence: = filthy substance; ► which renders people dirty and unclean; ≈ associated with sinfulness
= particle marking a proposition as not true

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior
= state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to instruct|to give instruction|to teach|to give understanding|to explain
Node.definition: = pattern of actions by which someone helps others to gain knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= an infant who has recently become accustomed to food other than its mother's milk; ≈ associated with inner peace and satisfaction as a weaned child does not continually search for its mother's breast anymore

= white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex
literally: taken from the (mother's) breasts; hence: = process by which babies are getting accustomed to food other than the mother's milk; ≈ associated with babies
= one of the breasts of a woman or other female mammal

= legal order that people are expected to obey; ≈ rejected by some as a heavy burden|= the letters tsade and qoph of the Hebrew alphabet recited as part of a kind of nursery rhyme; ≈ associated with childish behavior and therefore looked upon with contempt

literally: scoffing; hence: = state in which a language is hard to understand and its words may sometimes come across as mocking
literally: tongue; hence: = a system of communication used by a community, ethnic group, or nation
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which someone is willing to do something
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= state in which an event is limited as far as duration, quantity, and/or intensity are concerned
= state in which an event is limited as far as duration, quantity, and/or intensity are concerned
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: to stumble; hence: = process by which humans do not live up to the expectations others have of them

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
= causative action by which someone tries to gain control over someone else in an unjust way, ◄ as if that person were an animal caught in a net or trap
= action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence
= action by which someone shows contempt for people and ideas
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= abode of the dead; ≈ considered to be a remote place, deep in the earth, with power over humankind, without remembrance, without praising God

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
= arrangement undertaken by and legally binding on parties
= causative process by which an event has a tremendous impact on someone, ◄ compared to a beating with a whip, ► resulting in suffering and/or loss of life
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
literally: falsehood; hence: = things that cannot be trusted
= kind of behavior ► through which one aims to attain a state of well being
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= block of stone, whether fully square or not;◄ found in nature or hewn from a quarry; ► used for building houses, walls, and other constructions
= block of stone, whether fully square or not;◄ found in nature or hewn from a quarry; ► used for building houses, walls, and other constructions
exact meaning unsure; probably: = state of having been carefully chosen and tested, ≈ with the connotation of being suitable for its purpose
= the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it
= state in which an object can bear an exceedingly heavy weight, and so can be trusted to function as it is supposed to

Node.gloss: to have faith|to keep faith|to trust|to believe
Node.definition: = state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or deity, which means that this person or deity does only speak the truth but is also faithful, and willing and able to help

Node.gloss: to be impatient|to be unable to wait
Node.definition: = state in which someone feels a strong urge to perform a particular action, ◄ caused by emotions, ► and resulting in actions
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= a weight suspended on the end of a string, ► used by builders to determine whether a wall was straight or not; ≈ often used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards
= causative action by which one inanimate object strikes against another object with strength so that the latter object will be moved from its place and destroyed
= pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction
= kind of behavior ► through which one aims to attain a state of well being
literally: falsehood; hence: = things that cannot be trusted
= state in which people, animals, or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= process by which a certain condition comes to a sudden end
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= abode of the dead; ≈ considered to be a remote place, deep in the earth, with power over humankind, without remembrance, without praising God
= arrangement undertaken by and legally binding on parties
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
= causative process by which an event has a tremendous impact on someone, ◄ compared to a beating with a whip, ► resulting in suffering and/or loss of life
linker denoting a habitual circumstantial relationship between two events

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= causative process by which an event causes people to shake with fear

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= a piece of furniture upon which a person reclines or lies down
= a large piece of cloth used as a covering, as on a bed, but also in a more figurative sense to signify a condition that affects people, as if they are covered by it
= state in which an object is relatively small in size, ≈ with the connotation of being too small to be able to do what it is intended for
= action by which humans pull up their legs to make themselves as small as possible ► to keep warm during the night
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain, also known as Baal Perazim (בַּעַל־פְרָצִים) ► location where king David (דָּוִד) defeated the Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= town; ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► one of the four Hivite (חִוִּי) cities that made a covenant with Joshua (יְהֹושׁוּעַ)

Node.gloss: to rouse oneself|to get ready|to prepare oneself
Node.definition: liteallly: to shake; hence: = action by which humans and deities are preparing themselves for action

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which an object is considered as not belonging to a certain group of objects

Node.gloss: to make (someone) a slave or servant|to make (someone) serve or work|to enslave|to carry out a task|to serve|to do work|to minister
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone in authority causes others to assume a position of subservience and carry out specific duties, tasks, and obligations|= action by which a person provides a service ► for a specific purpose or on behalf of another
= state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
to behave in an arrogant way

Node.gloss: to get stuck|to rest firmly|to be tight
Node.definition: = state in which objects cannot be moved from a certain place
= material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else
= literally: finish; hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans and objects to completely disappear from existance
literally: to cut a decision; hence: = action by which humans or deities come to a formal and authoritative decision about something
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption

= causative action by which someone breaks the soil with the help of a plow, pulled by domestic animals; ► to make it ready for cultivation; ≈ usually regarded as a strenuous task which requires much energy

= causative action by which someone breaks the soil with the help of a plow, pulled by domestic animals; ► to make it ready for cultivation; ≈ usually regarded as a strenuous task which requires much energy

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable

= causative action by which someone breaks the soil with the help of a plow, pulled by domestic animals; ► to make it ready for cultivation; ≈ usually regarded as a strenuous task which requires much energy

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

= a cultivated plant that grows to around 30 cm high and has a lacy leaf like dill or carrot and a greenish blue flower with five petals; the base of the flower becomes a seedpod that contains many round, black, sharp smelling seeds; ► used in cooking

meaning unsure; probably: = a plant of the same family as the carrot, reaching a height of 50 60 cm; it branches from the base and has similar leaves and flowers, though its seeds have a sharper smell; ◄ Cuminum cyminum; ► it is planted and harvested each year, and its seeds are used in cooking and as medicine
= causative action by which someone takes a quantity of a dry substance or a liquid with one's hand and scatters it over an object

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= cereal plant bearing dense four sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

= a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

meaning unsure, probably: = type of grain with loose ears and triangular grains which do not loosen from the chaff when ripening; grows in relatively infertile and dry soil; with a sweet, nutty flavor; ◄ Triticum dicoccum; ► used for making bread; ≈ regarded as inferior to wheat (חִטָּה)
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans to possess particular knowledge
= practices that conform to the laws of God
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior

= wooden board with sharp stones or pieces of iron tightly wedged into small holes; ► dragged over harvested grain with the help of a draft animal to separate grain from straw or husk; ≈ symbol of power and aggression
= causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression

= a cultivated plant that grows to around 30 cm high and has a lacy leaf like dill or carrot and a greenish blue flower with five petals; the base of the flower becomes a seedpod that contains many round, black, sharp smelling seeds; ► used in cooking

= ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made as a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outher rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground, and occasionally for other purposes, such as threshing grain
= a cart wheel primarily used for separating the grain from the straw

meaning unsure; probably: = a plant of the same family as the carrot, reaching a height of 50 60 cm; it branches from the base and has similar leaves and flowers, though its seeds have a sharper smell; ◄ Cuminum cyminum; ► it is planted and harvested each year, and its seeds are used in cooking and as medicine
literally: to cause to turn; hence: = causative action by which humans cause a round object to move by turning it over and over on its axis
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► used for walking or as attribute of a ruler; also used for threshing; ≈ associated with authority and punishment
= action by which humans strike another object repeatedly + with a stick or a similar wooden instrument, ► so that items attached to this object will be released

= a cultivated plant that grows to around 30 cm high and has a lacy leaf like dill or carrot and a greenish blue flower with five petals; the base of the flower becomes a seedpod that contains many round, black, sharp smelling seeds; ► used in cooking

meaning unsure; probably: = a plant of the same family as the carrot, reaching a height of 50 60 cm; it branches from the base and has similar leaves and flowers, though its seeds have a sharper smell; ◄ Cuminum cyminum; ► it is planted and harvested each year, and its seeds are used in cooking and as medicine
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= causative action by which humans or deities reduce an object to fine particles; ≈ sometimes used figuratively to denote the destruction of a kingdom
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression
= causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression
= process by which an object produces noise when moving

= ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made as a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outher rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground
= a cart wheel primarily used for separating the grain from the straw
= horse; ► primarily used for soldiers to ride on, but also for agricultural purposes
= causative action by which humans or deities reduce an object to fine particles; ≈ sometimes used figuratively to denote the destruction of a kingdom

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place
= causative process by which a deity causes events to increase in intensity
